parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post mentions Kelemen Hunor, who is a parliamentary candidate.  While not explicitly endorsing him, the reference is clear and directly links to a news article about him.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed for wide public reach. The hashtags further suggest an intention to reach a broad audience interested in Romanian politics.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Potentially True. While the post presents itself as news reporting, the timing (close to the election) and the focus on a specific candidate's actions related to vote counting could subtly influence voter perception. The headline "Kelemen Hunor on vote recount: 'oil on the fire'" suggests a negative connotation, potentially impacting voters' opinions.  However, the post itself doesn't explicitly urge voters to vote for or against anyone.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. The post links to a news article, suggesting journalistic intent. However, the selection of this particular news item and its presentation on a paid social media platform, close to the election, blurs the line between objective reporting and subtle political influence.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post doesn't express a personal opinion; it presents news related to a candidate, which could be interpreted as influencing the vote.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1302675587576771</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post presents a complex case. While it links to a news article and doesn't explicitly endorse or discourage voting for any candidate, the context is crucial. The reference to Kelemen Hunor, a parliamentary candidate, coupled with the potentially negative framing of the news headline, and the timing of the paid post close to the election, raises concerns about its potential to subtly influence voters.  The "in dubio pro reo" principle should be applied, but the proximity to the election and the targeting of a specific candidate make a clear determination difficult.  The lack of explicit calls to action weakens the case for a clear violation, but the potential for indirect influence remains.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate>
    <name>Kelemen Hunor</name>
    <impact>NEGATIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Maszol.ro</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Maszol.ro, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu ID-ul 1302675587576771, care, deși se prezintă ca o știre, face referire la candidatul Kelemen Hunor într-un context negativ, influențând astfel percepția alegătorilor.  Titlul știrii, „Kelemen Hunor despre renumărarea voturilor: „ulei pe foc””, are un efect electoral negativ, având potențialul de a-i determina pe unii alegători să nu voteze pentru acesta.  Postarea, cu o cheltuială de 100-199 RON, a atins 15.000-20.000 de impresii, având o estimare a acoperirii de 500.000-1.000.000 de persoane.  Deși nu există un îndemn explicit la vot, contextul apropiat de alegeri și prezentarea subiectivă a informației constituie o încălcare a legii.  Datele de contact ale Maszol.ro sunt disponibile pe pagina lor de Facebook și în informațiile furnizate de Facebook Ad Library.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
